definition: venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
leaf venation (botany)/the pattern of veins on a leaf, characteristic of each species

sentences.english: That, in turn, means lots of big veins.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，這就意味着需要許多大型葉脈。

sentences.english: Try to scratch and print the veins of a leaf on paper.
sentences.chinese: 嘗試把葉脈挖出來然後把它畫在紙片上。

sentences.english: This vein cutting is just one method the beetles used to prepare a safe meal.
sentences.chinese: 切斷葉脈只是甲蟲準備安全食物的一個方法。

sentences.english: Recursion means repetition in subelements, like the pattern of veins in a leaf.
sentences.chinese: 遞歸手段重複子元素，如葉脈的排列。

sentences.english: We can see veins on a leaf.
sentences.chinese: 我們在葉子上可以看到葉脈。

sentences.english: I appreciate it mainly because of the deeply divided leaf lobes and the greenish yellow veins.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡它的深紋葉瓣及黃綠色的葉脈。

sentences.english: The leave were full of holes and there were only yellow net-like nerves remaining in many places.
sentences.chinese: 葉子也千瘡百孔了，好些地方只剩黃黃的網狀葉脈。

sentences.english: I believe he pierced the slow vegetable veins with his long beak.
sentences.chinese: 我相信，他用長長的喙刺穿植物遲鈍的葉脈。

sentences.english: And veins are the basis of it all.
Pay particular attention to the areas right near the center vein.
sentences.chinese: 特別注意一下中心葉脈附近的區域。

sentences.english: The structure of leaf vein is complicated.
sentences.chinese: 葉脈結構較爲複雜，主脈發達。

sentences.english: Vein density is a sign of how much a leaf has invested in the network.
sentences.chinese: 葉脈密度標誌着樹葉在這個網狀結構中投入了多少。
